definition: gas/air/smell/weather/to make angry/to annoy/to get angry/vital energy/qi
soul/mortal soul, i.e. attached to the body

sentences.english: Generously to show him as commander in chief for the fearless courage and great spirit hung.
sentences.chinese: 慨然表現出他作爲統帥的無畏膽識與雄大氣魄。

sentences.english: And this year is a test of our mettle.
sentences.chinese: 2016年是賂“考驗我們氣魄”的一年。

sentences.english: He is a man of courage.
That is the true gladiator feeling.
sentences.chinese: 這是真正的鬥士的氣魄。

sentences.english: Do you have the courage that will never disappear.
sentences.chinese: 你有那永不會消失的氣魄。

sentences.english: Baoding entire ancient dignified, magnify very ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 全部寶鼎古樸凝重，氣魄弘大，非常宏偉。

sentences.english: We were all impressed with the magnificence of Russia's Winter Palace.
sentences.chinese: 氣魄宏偉的俄國冬宮給我們留下了深刻的印象。

sentences.english: Our soldiery exhibited great bravery in the battle.
sentences.chinese: 我們的軍隊在戰鬥中證明出強大的氣魄。

definition: vigor of strokes in calligraphy or drawing/vigor of style in literary composition
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
one's bosom (the seat of emotions)/breast/broad-minded and open/to think about/to cherish

lit. warp and weft in weaving; vertically and horizontal/length and breadth/criss-crossed/able to move unhindered/abbr. for 合縱連橫|合纵连横[He2 zong4 Lian2 heng2], School of Diplomacy during the Warring States Period (475-221 BC)
